english: age; years of age; lifespan; service length

etymology.description: semantic: 齒 (“tooth”) + phonetic: 令; simplified: 齒 → 齿.
etymology.interpretation: Teeth are closely tied to judging age, so the tooth component supplies the meaning of age and lifespan. 令 contributes the pronunciation while the semantic part points to the idea of age, as in checking teeth to estimate years.
etymology.simplification: Component simplification during the script reform: the semantic component 齒 was simplified to 齿; the phonetic 令 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 她的年龄(她的年齡)只有十八岁(只有十八歲)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de niánlíng zhǐyǒu shíbā suì.

examples.chinese: 达到法定退休年龄(達到法定退休年齡)，他可以申请退休(他可以申請退休)。
examples.pinyin: Dádào fǎdìng tuìxiū niánlíng, tā kěyǐ shēnqǐng tuìxiū.
examples.english: Upon reaching the statutory retirement age, he can apply to retire.

examples.chinese: 这辆车的车龄(這輛車的車齡)已经十年了(已經十年了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liàng chē de chēlíng yǐjīng shí nián le.
examples.english: The car is already ten years old.
